title: Father and son behind Bondi Hanukkah festival shooting that killed 15, Australian police say
byline: Two alleged gunmen who killed 15 people at a Jewish celebration at Sydney’s Bondi Beach were a father and son, police said on Monday, as Australia began mourning victims of its worst gun violence in almost 30 years.

title: Showery conditions expected to enhance to some extend from tomorrow
byline: Under the influence of an Easterly wave, showery conditions are expected to enhance to some extend over the island from tomorrow (16), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Large-scale drug trafficker arrested in Wattala with over 21kg of ‘Kush’
byline: A 34-year old large-scale drug trafficker has been arrested in Wattala by the Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB), police said.

title: Showery conditions expected to enhance to some extent from tomorrow
byline: Under the influence of an Easterly wave, showery conditions are expected to enhance to some extent over the island from tomorrow (16), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: School bus accident in Colombia kills 17, injures 20
byline: Seventeen people were killed and 20 were injured after a bus carrying school children fell off a cliff in a rural area in northern Colombia, the local governor said on Sunday night.

title: 6 including 2 women arrested for illegal excavations in Puthukudiyiruppu
byline: Six suspects, including two women, have been arrested for allegedly digging a plot of land in search of artifacts in the Devi Puram area of Puthukudiyiruppu.

title: Over 20,000 families still sheltered in relief centres following Cyclone Ditwah – DMC
byline: The Disaster Management Center (DMC) reports that over 20,000 families affected by the recent disaster caused by Cyclone Ditwah are still sheltered in relief centres.

title: School students permitted to use November SLTB season tickets during December
byline: Schoolchildren have been permitted to travel on Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) buses during this month using their November season tickets.

title: Hong Kong tycoon Jimmy Lai found guilty of collusion with foreign forces
byline: Hong Kong’s High Court on Monday found pro-democracy campaigner and tycoon Jimmy Lai guilty of collusion with foreign forces under a China-imposed national security law that could see him jailed for life.

title: Medical report of MP Asoka Ranwala yet to be received – Police
byline: Police Media Spokesperson Assistant Superintendent of Police F. U. Wootler stated that the police have not yet received the medical report of Former Speaker and NPP Parliamentarian Asoka Ranwala, who was involved in a vehicular collision at Sapugaskanda.

title: Schools to reopen tomorrow, 147 to remain closed - Education Ministry
byline: Schools that were closed due to the disaster situation caused by Cyclone Ditwah are scheduled to reopen island-wide tomorrow (16).

title: Nawalapitiya-Kandy main road reopens after 18-day closure
byline: The Nawalapitiya-Kandy main road, which was damaged during Cyclone Ditwah, has been reopened to vehicular traffic today (15) after remaining closed for 18 days.

title: No Sri Lankans injured in shooting at Sydney’s Bondi Beach – Dy Foreign Minister
byline: The Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs and Foreign Employment, Arun Hemachandra, has confirmed that no Sri Lankans were injured in the shooting incident that occurred at a Jewish celebration at Sydney’s Bondi Beach on Sunday.

title: Sri Lanka President condemns Bondi Beach terror attack, extends condolences
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated that Sri Lanka strongly condemns the terrorist attack that occurred at Bondi Beach in Sydney, Australia and has extended his deepest condolences to the Government and people of Australia.

title: Former CPC Chairman Dhammika Ranatunga arrested
byline: Former Chairman of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC), Dhammika Ranatunga, has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Google is turning any headphones into real-time translation earbuds
byline: Live translation is shaping up to be one of the most practical (and competitive) uses of generative AI, with real-life implications for how people communicate across languages.

title: ‘Zootopia 2’ reclaims No. 1 spot at box office, grosses $1B worldwide
byline: “Zootopia 2” regained the No. 1 spot at the domestic box office with $26.3 million in its third weekend of release, according to studio estimates Sunday, as The Walt Disney Co. animated sequel became the year’s second film to gross $1 billion worldwide.

title: Suspect arrested with T-56 firearm and ammunition in Batapola
byline: A suspect has been arrested for the possession of a T-56 assault rifle, two magazines, and 45 rounds of ammunition by officers of the Ampara Division Criminal Investigation Unit.

title: Two stabbed at entertainment complex in Japan, suspect arrested
byline: Japanese police said on Monday (Dec 15) they arrested a man in connection with the alleged stabbing of two people at an entertainment complex housing the female pop music group HKT48 in the southern city of Fukuoka, leaving them with non-life-threatening injuries.

title: Brake defect in ex-Speaker Asoka Ranwala’s vehicle detected during inspection – Police
byline: A defect in the braking system has been observed in the vehicle of former Speaker and National People’s Power (NPP) Parliamentarian Asoka Ranwala which was involved in an accident on Thursday (11) in Sapugaskanda, police stated.

title: Vessel carrying humanitarian aid donated by Pakistan arrives at Colombo Harbour
byline: A consignment of humanitarian aid donated by the Government of Pakistan to support the disaster-affected people has been brought to the Colombo Harbour aboard a special vessel.

title: Hollywood director Rob Reiner and wife Michele found dead in LA home
byline: Legendary Hollywood film-maker and actor Rob Reiner and his wife Michele have been found dead in their Los Angeles home.

title: Regions under level one and level two warnings are also susceptible to landslides - NBRO
byline: Landslides are a natural phenomenon that occur across the world due to factors such as rainfall, earthquakes, volcanic activity among others.

title: Dammika Ranatunga granted bail, Bribery Commission informs court ex-Minister Arjuna Ranatunga will be arrested
byline: Former Chairman of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CEYPETCO), Dammika Ranatunga, who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) earlier today has been granted bail.

title: Annual budget of Galle MC presented by NPP defeated
byline: The annual budget of the Galle Municipal Council, which is controlled by the National People’s Power (NPP), has been defeated by a majority vote today (15).

title: Nearly 1,000 arrested in island-wide anti-drug raids
byline: A total of 981 individuals have been arrested yesterday (14) in island-wide raids conducted under the theme “Nation United – National Drive”, aimed at eradicating narcotics from the country.

title: Former CPC Chairman Dammika Ranatunga arrested
byline: Former Chairman of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC), Dammika Ranatunga, has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Special security arrangement in urban areas and places of worship, 2,500 police personnel deployed in Western Province
byline: Special police security arrangements have been made in urban areas and places of worship in view of the upcoming festive season, the Police Media Spokesperson, Assistant Superintendent of Police F. U. Wootler stated.

title: Five including foreign women injured in accident on Southern Expressway
byline: At least five individuals traveling in a van, including two foreign women, have been injured in an accident near the 168-kilometer post on the Southern Expressway.

title: 640 schools in three provinces will not reopen tomorrow - Secretary
byline: A total of 640 schools in the Uva, Central and North Western provinces will not reopen tomorrow, the Secretary to the Ministry of Education, Nalaka Kaluwewe has announced.

title: Hospital in Badulla temporarily closed due to risk of landslides
byline: The Badulla Spring Valley Regional Hospital has been temporarily closed due to the risk of landslides, the Ministry of Health of the Uva Province has announced.

title: Dammika Ranatunga granted bail, CIABOC informs court Arjuna Ranatunga will be arrested
byline: The Former Chairman of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation, Dammika Ranatunga, who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption earlier today has been granted bail.

title: Technical Committee on Rules of Origin appointed to strengthen trade facilitation framework
byline: Sri Lanka Customs has inaugurated a Technical Committee on Rules of Origin (TCRO) in a bid to modernize the country’s trade governance and improve transparency in the administration of Rules of Origin, according to an official statement issued today.

title: Sri Lanka’s manufacturing and services sectors expand in November 2025
byline: Sri Lanka’s Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI) for November 2025 recorded growth in both manufacturing and services sectors.

title: 15-hour water cut in Mahara and Gampaha areas on Wednesday
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board has announced a 15-hour water supply cut for residents of Mahara and Gampaha.

title: World Bank announces US$ 120 million in emergency support for Sri Lanka
byline: The World Bank Group Bank has announced up to US$ 120 million in emergency support for Sri Lanka to assist ongoing recovery and restoration activities.

title: Nutrition allowance to be provided to expectant mothers from tomorrow
byline: The Rs. 5,000 nutrition allowance proposed for expectant mothers in view of the prevailing disaster situation and the upcoming festive season will be disbursed from tomorrow (16).

title: Australia plans tougher gun laws after Bondi Beach shooting
byline: Australia vowed stricter gun laws on Monday as it began mourning victims of its worst mass shooting in almost 30 years, in which police accused a father and son of killing 15 people at a Jewish celebration at Sydney’s famed Bondi Beach.

title: Chandika Hathurusinghe files new lawsuit against SLC at Court of Arbitration for Sport
byline: Former head coach of Sri Lanka national cricket team Chandika Hathurusinghe has filed a new lawsuit against Sri Lanka Cricket over the termination of his contract.

title: Showers likely in several parts of the country after 1pm tomorrow
byline: Showers will occur at times in the Northern, North-Central, Eastern, Uva and Central provinces tomorrow, the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: Education Ministry announces revised school term dates
byline: The second phase of the third school term, which was postponed until December 16 due to the disaster situation that affected the country, will commence tomorrow.

title: Sri Lanka’s economy expands by 5.4% in Q3 2025
byline: Sri Lanka’s economy expanded by 5.4 percent in the third quarter of 2025, according to the Department of Census and Statistics (DCS).

title: Inland Revenue Dept. exceeds its revenue target by Rs. 50 billion
byline: The Department of Inland Revenue has exceeded its revenue target, generating an additional Rs. 50 billion in tax revenue.

title: Gold jewelry, cash recovered by Army personnel during disaster relief operation returned to owners
byline: Sri Lanka Army personnel have returned cash amounting to Rs. 300,000 and gold jewelry valued at approximately Rs. 5 million recovered during on-going search operations as part of disaster relief work to their rightful owner.

title: Public warned of alarming spike in financial scams via social media
byline: The Sri Lanka Computer Emergency Readiness Team (Sri Lanka CERT) has issued a warning to the general public regarding a rise in frauds conducted via social media.

title: Several areas in Kandy remain under red landslide warning
byline: Red landslide warnings have been issued by the National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) to residents of several Divisional Secretariat divisions in the Kandy District.

title: President chairs National Council for Disaster Management
byline: The 16th meeting of the National Council for Disaster Management was held today (15) at the Presidential Secretariat under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.
